message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this incredible product that I think you'll love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $9000. This is a great deal, considering the product is worth $10000 to you. What do you think?
I appreciate your enthusiasm for the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $7500. I'm willing to make a serious offer, but I need to make sure it's a good deal for me.

I understand you're looking for a good deal, Bob, but I have to make sure I get a fair price for the product. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'm counteroffering at $8500. This is a compromise that I think we can both be happy with. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, Alice, but I'm still a bit above that. I'm willing to pay $7000 for the product. I think that's a fair price considering what I've seen so far.

I understand you're trying to get the best deal, Bob, but I'm not willing to go as low as $7000. I'm willing to make one more concession, so I'm counteroffering at $8000. This is my final offer, and I think it's a fair price considering the product's value to you. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'm afraid I'll have to consider other options.

I appreciate your final offer, Alice, but I'm afraid I'm still a bit above that. I'm willing to pay $7200 for the product. I think that's a fair price considering the product's value to me, and I'm willing to walk away if you can't meet me there.
